title: Remove streams from channels
description:
Implement ability to remove streams from channels:
- When viewing a channel's assigned streams, show remove button (X or minus icon)
- Confirmation before removal (optional, could be a setting)
- Call API to remove stream from channel
- Optimistic UI update with rollback on error
- Success/error toast notifications
- Alternative: drag stream out of channel to 'unassign' area

title: Add file upload functionality for logos in Edit Channel modal
description: Added ability to upload logo images from local files in the Edit Channel modal. Added file input with hidden input, 'Upload Image' button, CSS styling for the upload section with 'or' divider between URL and file options.

title: Streams pane dropdowns should match Channels pane style
description: The Providers and Groups dropdown filters in the Streams pane should have the same styling and behavior as the Groups dropdown in the Channels pane (consistent UI/UX across panes).
close_reason: Fixed: Streams pane now uses multi-select checkbox dropdowns for Providers and Groups filters, matching the Channels pane style.

title: Replace unicode/text icons with Material Icons in HistoryToolbar, EditModeToggle, and EditModeBanner
close_reason: Added Material Icons CDN to index.html, replaced unicode characters with Material Icons in HistoryToolbar (undo, redo, bookmark_add, close, fiber_manual_record), EditModeToggle (edit, check), and EditModeBanner (edit). Updated CSS for proper icon sizing.

title: Frontend: Two-pane layout with channels (left) and streams (right)
description:
Create the main UI layout:
- Left pane: Channels list
  - Display channel name, number, logo
  - Show count of assigned streams per channel
  - Clicking a channel shows its assigned streams (expandable or inline)
  - Scrollable list with virtualization for performance
- Right pane: Streams list  
  - Display stream name, logo, provider info
  - Visual indicator if stream is already assigned to selected channel
  - Scrollable list with virtualization for performance
- Responsive layout that works on various screen sizes
- Loading states and error handling

title: Backend API endpoints for frontend consumption
description:
Create FastAPI endpoints that proxy/aggregate Dispatcharr data:
- GET /api/channels - list channels with filtering support
- GET /api/channels/{id}/streams - get streams assigned to a channel
- GET /api/streams - list all streams with filtering support
- GET /api/channel-groups - list channel groups (for filter dropdowns)
- GET /api/stream-groups - list stream groups (for filter dropdowns)
- GET /api/providers - list M3U accounts/providers (for filter dropdowns)
- POST /api/channels/{id}/add-stream - add stream to channel
- POST /api/channels/{id}/remove-stream - remove stream from channel
- Query params for filtering: channel_group, m3u_account, search/name

title: Debug channel groups not all displaying
description: Some channel groups like 'National Sports Networks' and 'Local Channels' are not showing in the UI. Need to investigate why groups are missing.

title: Fix duplicate channel numbers when using push-down and drag operations in edit mode
Fix EPG Data endpoint path
description: Changed backend endpoint from /api/epg/data/ to /api/epg/epgdata/ to match Dispatcharr API. The EPG Data dropdown in the Edit Channel modal now properly fetches and displays EPG entries.

title: Fix Stream Profile endpoint path
description: Changed backend endpoint from /api/stream_profiles/ to /api/core/streamprofiles/ to match Dispatcharr API. The Stream Profile dropdown in the Edit Channel modal now properly shows all available profiles (ffmpeg, Proxy, Redirect, streamlink, etc.).

title: Add Get from EPG button for TVG-ID field
description: Added a 'Get from EPG' button next to the TVG-ID input field in the Edit Channel modal. Clicking it opens a searchable dropdown that allows users to search EPG data entries and automatically populate the TVG-ID field with the selected entry's tvg_id value.

title: Fix EPG Data API response handling
description: The frontend expected a paginated response with .results property, but Dispatcharr's EPG data endpoint returns a flat array. Fixed api.ts to return EPGData[] and App.tsx to use the array directly.

title: Fix EPG Data search with client-side filtering
description: Dispatcharr's EPG data API doesn't support server-side search. Implemented client-side filtering: EPG data is loaded once on mount, and search terms filter the local data by name or tvg_id. Also increased dropdown height from 200px to 300px and display limit from 50 to 100 items.

title: Add EPG source name display in EPG data dropdowns
Update Get from EPG button to copy TVG-ID when EPG data is selected
Add OS-style window titlebar to Edit Channel modal
Filter out auto-created channel groups from display
Fix EPG dropdown color contrast for better readability
description: Changed EPG dropdown colors to improve readability on dark background: name from #ccc to #fff, tvgid from #666 to #aaa, source from #646cff to #a8b4ff with lighter background

title: Resizable split pane with draggable divider for channels/streams
Renumber subsequent channels when deleting from contiguous list
description: When deleting a channel from a contiguous list, offer option to renumber subsequent channels (move them up). Also auto-renames channels if the channel number appears in the name.

title: Docker compose configuration for production deployment
description: Simplified docker-compose.yml for production deployment. Single container runs on port 6100, uses a named volume (ecm-config) for persistent settings storage, and includes host.docker.internal mapping for accessing Dispatcharr on the host machine.

title: Inline channel detail: show streams underneath channel when clicked
description: Replace the separate ChannelDetail pane with inline expansion. When a channel is clicked, its assigned streams should appear directly underneath the channel item in the channels list, similar to an accordion pattern. This provides a more compact and intuitive UI.

title: TVG-ID assignment for channels
description:
Add ability to set TVG-ID on channels. Features:
- Channel model has tvg_id field (string, max 255 chars, nullable)
- Manual text entry for tvg_id
- Option to auto-assign tvg_id from EPG data (EPGData has tvg_id field) if an EPG is assigned
- Show current tvg_id in channel edit view
- TVG-ID is used for EPG program matching

title: Add inline channel name editing
close_reason: Added ability to edit channel names inline when in Edit Mode. Click on a channel name to edit it. Includes CSS styling for editable state and input field.

title: Bulk selection and operations
description:
Multi-select support for bulk operations:

Selection mechanics:
- Click to select single item
- Ctrl+Click to toggle additional items
- Shift+Click to select range
- Ctrl+A to select all (in focused pane)
- Click elsewhere to deselect all
- Visual selection indicator (checkbox or highlight)

Bulk operations for streams:
- Add multiple selected streams to a channel (drag group or button)
- Remove multiple streams from a channel

Bulk operations for channels:
- Delete multiple channels
- Assign multiple channels to a group
- Renumber selected channels sequentially

UI:
- Selection count indicator
- Bulk action toolbar/context menu when items selected
- Confirmation dialogs for destructive operations

title: Stream profile assignment for channels
description:
Add ability to set stream profile on channels. Features:
- Channel model has stream_profile_id field (integer, nullable)
- Option to use default profile (null/unset)
- Dropdown to select from available stream profiles (/api/stream_profiles/)
- StreamProfile model has: id, name, command, parameters, is_active, locked
- Show current profile name in channel edit view
- Profile determines how streams are processed/transcoded

title: Assign EPG source to channel
description:
Add ability to assign an EPG source to a channel. Features:
- Edit channel to select from available EPG sources (/api/epg/sources/)
- Channel model has epg_data_id field (integer, nullable) referencing EPGData
- EPGData has epg_source field linking to EPGSource
- Show currently assigned EPG source name on channel details
- Dropdown/autocomplete for EPG source selection

title: Fix adding streams to newly created channels in edit mode
Require edit mode for stream operations
description:
Stream drag-drop onto channels, stream removal, and stream reordering now require edit mode to be active. Changes made:
- handleStreamDrop in ChannelsPane.tsx only allows drops in edit mode
- handleStreamDragOver only shows visual feedback in edit mode
- handleRemoveStream only works in edit mode
- handleStreamDragEnd (reorder) only works in edit mode
- handleStreamDropOnChannel and handleBulkStreamDropOnChannel in App.tsx now require edit mode
- SortableStreamItem component now accepts isEditMode prop and disables drag handles and hides remove button when not in edit mode
- Added CSS for disabled stream-drag-handle state

title: Channel groups as tree with drag-and-drop channel assignment
description:
Channel groups displayed as a tree structure in the left pane:

Structure:
- Channel groups are collapsible tree nodes
- Channels are leaf nodes nested under their group
- Ungrouped channels shown at root level or in 'Uncategorized' group

Drag-and-drop operations:
- Drag channel into a group to assign it
- Drag channel out of group (to root or another group) to reassign
- Drag channel between groups to move it
- API call to update channel's channel_group_id on drop

Group management (TBD - UI style pending):
- Create new channel groups
- Rename groups
- Delete groups (move channels to ungrouped or another group)
- Reorder groups

Visual:
- Expand/collapse icons for groups
- Channel count badge per group
- Indentation for hierarchy
- Drag handles or full-row draggable

Note: Detailed UI styling to be determined later

title: Stream priority reordering within channels
description:
Allow reordering streams within a channel to set priority:
- When viewing a channel's assigned streams, allow drag-and-drop reorder
- First stream = highest priority (used for playback)
- Visual drag handles for stream items
- API call to update channel's streams array order
- Optimistic UI with rollback on error
- Visual indication of priority order (numbers or position)

title: Add delete channel functionality
Show provider name on inline channel streams
description: Display the provider/M3U account name for each stream shown in the inline channel detail view, so users can identify which provider each stream comes from.

title: Drag-and-drop: Add streams to channels
description:
Implement drag-and-drop functionality to add streams to channels:
- Streams in right pane are draggable
- Channels in left pane are drop targets
- Visual feedback during drag (highlight valid drop targets)
- On drop: call API to add stream to channel
- Optimistic UI update with rollback on error
- Success/error toast notifications
- Prevent duplicate stream assignment (visual indicator + validation)

Tech: Use react-dnd or @dnd-kit/core for drag-and-drop implementation

title: Fix channel drag-drop to use insertion/shift behavior instead of swap
Frontend: Filtering for channels and streams
description:
Add filtering capabilities to both panes:

Channels pane filters:
- Channel group dropdown (populated from API)
- Name search (interactive text input with debounce)

Streams pane filters:
- Stream/channel group dropdown
- Provider/M3U account dropdown (populated from API)
- Name search (interactive text input with debounce)

Implementation:
- Filter controls at top of each pane
- Filters applied client-side for responsiveness, with option to query server
- Clear/reset filters button
- Filter state preserved during session

title: Improve channel editing UX: double-click to edit and hover delete button
description: Changed channel number and name editing from single-click to double-click to make it easier to select channels without accidentally entering edit mode. Added a hover-visible delete button on each channel row (only visible in edit mode) for quick access to channel deletion. Removed the redundant delete button from the expanded channel section.

title: Group streams by source and sort alphabetically within groups
Add channel number and name editing to Edit Channel modal
description: Extended Edit Channel modal to allow editing channel number and name fields. Added ChannelMetadataChanges interface fields, state management, editable header fields UI, and corresponding CSS styles.

title: Logo modal should only open in Edit Mode
description: Currently clicking on a channel's logo opens the logo selection modal even when not in Edit Mode. The logo should only be clickable/editable when Edit Mode is enabled, similar to how other editing operations are gated.
close_reason: Fixed: Logo modal now only opens when Edit Mode is enabled. Added isEditMode check and updated CSS to remove hover effects when not editable.

title: Fix auto-rename not working on channel drag-drop reorder
description: When dragging channels to reorder them, the auto-rename setting is not being applied even when enabled.

title: Require edit mode to create new channels
description: Changed the New button to only be visible when in edit mode. This simplifies the workflow and ensures channel creation follows the same edit-then-commit pattern as other operations.

title: Require channel number for new channels and handle conflicts
description: All channels must have a number. Add Channel modal should require a number and when it conflicts, ask user to push channels down or add to end of group.

title: Fix push-down creating duplicate channel numbers
description: Fixed issue where push-down during channel creation caused duplicate channel numbers. The fix involved: 1) Splitting the localChannels sync useEffect to prevent overwrites during edit mode, 2) Only syncing when entering edit mode, not on every channels prop change, 3) Manually adding new channels to localChannels after API creation.

title: Channel reordering with automatic renumbering
description:
Drag-and-drop reordering of channels with smart renumbering:
- Channels can be dragged to reorder in the list
- When a channel is inserted between two others, renumber affected channels
- Example: channels 1,2,3 - moving 3 between 1 and 2 results in: 1,3→2,2→3
- Use the /api/channels/channels/assign/ bulk endpoint for efficient renumbering
- Visual drag handle or entire row draggable
- Optimistic UI update with rollback on error
- Consider decimal numbers for insertion without full renumber (e.g., 1.5 between 1 and 2) as alternative mode

title: Dispatcharr API client with JWT authentication
description:
Create a Python API client for Dispatcharr:
- JWT token authentication (login, token refresh)
- GET channels list with pagination support
- GET streams list with pagination support  
- GET streams for a specific channel
- PATCH channel to update streams array (add/remove streams)
- Error handling and retry logic
- Environment-based configuration (DISPATCHARR_URL, credentials)

title: Project setup: Docker, FastAPI backend, React frontend scaffolding
description:
Set up the foundational project structure:
- Dockerfile for single container deployment
- FastAPI backend with CORS, static file serving
- React frontend with Vite or Create React App
- docker-compose.yml for development
- Environment variable configuration for Dispatcharr URL and credentials
- Basic health check endpoint

title: Apply auto-rename when reordering channels by drag-drop
description:
Fixed auto-rename not applying when channels are reordered via drag-drop.

Changes:
1. Extracted auto-rename logic into reusable helper function 'computeAutoRename' that takes channel name, old number, and new number and returns the new name if a rename should apply.

2. Updated contiguous reorder path (when dragging channels in a sequential group):
   - Now computes auto-rename for each affected channel
   - Stages individual channel updates with both number and name changes
   - Updates local state with renamed names immediately

3. Updated non-contiguous swap path (when dragging channels in a non-sequential group):
   - Computes auto-rename for both swapped channels
   - Includes name changes in the staged updates
   - Updates local state with renamed names immediately

Example: If channels are '110 Fox News', '111 Fox Business', '112 Fox Weather' and you drag Fox News to after Fox Weather, they now become '110 Fox Business', '111 Fox Weather', '112 Fox News' with the numbers in the names updated.

title: Channel number editing in UI
description:
Allow editing channel numbers directly in the UI:
- Display channel number for each channel in the list
- Inline editing (click to edit) or edit modal
- Validation: only allow floats or integers
- API call to update channel number on save
- Handle conflicts (warn if number already in use)
- Visual feedback on save success/failure

title: Gracenote Station ID for channels
description:
Add ability to set Gracenote Station ID on channels. Features:
- Channel model has tvc_guide_stationid field (string, max 255 chars, nullable)
- Numeric integer entry field for station ID
- Used for TVC/Gracenote guide matching

title: Track stream reorders and show detailed changes in exit dialog
description:
Fixed two issues with the edit mode exit dialog:

1. Stream reorders were not being tracked in the summary - added 'reorderChannelStreams' case to getSummary() in useEditMode.ts

2. Exit dialog now shows a detailed list of all pending changes:
   - Added OperationDetail interface to editMode.ts types
   - Added operationDetails array to EditModeSummary
   - Updated getSummary() to populate operation details with descriptions
   - Added 'Show details' toggle button to EditModeExitDialog
   - Added scrollable details panel showing numbered list of all operations
   - Added CSS for toggle button and details panel styling

title: Sort channel groups by lowest channel number
Channel logo selection and upload
description:
Add ability to set channel logos. Features:
- Display logo on each channel row
- Edit channel to select from existing logos (/api/channels/logos/)
- Option to assign logo from assigned EPG data (icon_url from EPGData)

title: Fix channel view not updating after stream drop in edit mode
close_reason: Added streams prop to ChannelsPane and updated useEffect to use local streams list in edit mode instead of making API calls. This ensures staged stream additions are reflected immediately in the UI.

title: Settings UI for Dispatcharr connection configuration
description: Add a settings modal UI to configure Dispatcharr connection (URL, username, password) instead of requiring environment variables. Settings are stored in a JSON file (/config/settings.json) and persist across container restarts. Includes test connection button, auto-popup on first load when not configured, and Settings button in header.

title: Channel group filter with multi-select checkboxes, hide unused groups
Fix auto-rename to detect number prefix in name regardless of current channel number
